programme.title: Shooting Gallery: Asteroids and Comets / Galactic Visions: Alien Worlds
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas, S01E18, See the sun, moon, planets, and galaxies through the eyes of intrepid machines that are blazing a trail across the solar system. A gateway to bold adventures, these cameras are delivering spectacular new cosmic vistas.

programme.title: Landsat
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Landsat, S04E06, Take a look at Landsat 8, the advanced planetary explorer with a 900 million dollar price tag! It is designed to peer across multiple wavelengths to reveal complex and ever-changing details that are undetectable by the human eye.

programme.title: Windows to Other Worlds / Fountain of Creation
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas, S01E13, See the sun, moon, planets, and galaxies through the eyes of intrepid machines that are blazing a trail across the solar system. A gateway to bold adventures, these cameras are delivering spectacular new cosmic vistas.

programme.title: Gravity
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Gravity, S03E04, Gravity has long been a force that has intrigued scientists. Now, for the first time scientists are probing to detect gravity waves in space as well as mapping the gravity patterns of the moon.

programme.title: Cosmic Rays
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Cosmic Rays, S04E04, Cosmic rays can tell us much about the universe. They are not simply another form of light, but carriers of information about powerful and unseen processes at work thousands or even millions of light years away.

programme.title: Hubble's Renaissance
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Hubble's Renaissance, S02E01, Before we can reach space, we must first be able to see it. Hundreds of years ago, the simple telescope was used to give us a seemingly closer vantage. Today, we use the awe-inspiring, and super powerful, Hubble Space Telescope.

programme.title: Stargazer's Paradise
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Stargazer's Paradise, S02E04, The Atacama desert is a perfect place for watching the night sky. With still winds and only a handful of cloudy nights each year, it allows scientists to get the absolute most out of their tools.

programme.title: Landing on Mars
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Landing on Mars, S03E06, Mars sparks our curiosity like no other planet because it is so reachable. Despite having landed there, most of the information we gather is still done by instruments in the planet's orbit.

programme.title: Virtual Universe
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Virtual Universe, S02E06, Our understanding of the cosmos is limited by the amount of time we have to see it. Fortunately, computer simulations can help us see how galaxies interact over millions of years, and even how dark matter structures the universe.

programme.title: Water Worlds
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Water Worlds, S03E03, The key ingredient to life in the universe is water. Until recently we thought Earth was the only place in the solar system to have any water at all. Now that probes are peering around nearby worlds we are finding that is just not the case.

programme.title: Science and the Shuttle
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Science and the Shuttle, S03E05, For more than 25 years the shuttle was our ticket to space, and our laboratory in orbit. Uncover the legacy of this amazing machine, and see what lies ahead.

programme.title: Rocky Shores / Silent Partner
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas, S01E14, See the sun, moon, planets, and galaxies through the eyes of intrepid machines that are blazing a trail across the solar system. A gateway to bold adventures, these cameras are delivering spectacular new cosmic vistas.

programme.title: Cosmic Rainbow
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Cosmic Rainbow, S02E03, In the world of astronomy, how do we overcome the limits imposed by our own eyesight? The universe comes alive by viewing the cosmos in infrared light to gamma radiation.

programme.title: Vesta Unveiled
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Vesta Unveiled, S03E02, With the Dawn missions exploration of the asteroid Vesta and the dwarf planet Ceres, asteroids are a hot topic. See what these incredible missions have uncovered.

programme.title: Superscopes
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Superscopes, S02E02, The human eye can only see visible light, a small spectrum of electromagnetic waves. Today, we have instruments that let us perceive all wavelengths.

programme.title: Night Fire
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Night Fire, S02E05, The Northern Lights are more than just beautiful; they tell us about the make up of our planet, our sun, and may even be a signpost for the possibility of life on other planets.

programme.title: Hidden Havens: Icy Moons / Icy Gems: Frozen Moons
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas, S01E17, See the sun, moon, planets, and galaxies through the eyes of intrepid machines that are blazing a trail across the solar system. A gateway to bold adventures, these cameras are delivering spectacular new cosmic vistas.

programme.title: Seasons of Saturn
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Seasons of Saturn, S03E01, Saturn is the second largest planet and has an astonishing 60 moons in its orbit. Thanks to the Cassini mission, it's also one of the most studied and most photographed planets in our neighborhood.

programme.title: Fermi Paradox
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Fermi Paradox, S04E05, The Fermi Paradox asks the ultimate question: Given a few reasonable assumptions about the chance of life arising elsewhere in the universe and the distance between the stars, why has an alien civilization not presented itself?
World War A - When Aliens Attack, 20160220000000 +0000, Are there extraterrestrials and what will happen when aliens attack us?

programme.title: The Space Shuttle Matures, Complex Space Construction & The Final Years of the Space Shuttle
programme.desc: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration, S01E13, The Space Shuttle Matures - The Space Transportation System changes the nature of orbital missions. Complex Construction in Space - Confidence in the shuttle begins to return and engineers for get the lessons of the past.

programme.title: Rebuilding Apollo, Orbiting Carbon & Zero Gravity Training
programme.desc: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration, S01E08, Rebuilding Project Apollo - After the Apollo 1 disaster NASA resumes manned space flight. Orbiting Carbon Observatory 2 - Monitoring the Earth's Co2 levels in unprecedented detail. Zero Gravity Training - Parabolic flights.

programme.title: The Apollo Program Begins, Caves & Planck
programme.desc: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration, S01E07, The Apollo Program Begins - At the very beginning of NASA's moon project things go wrong. Caves - ESA's special training program for astronauts. Planck - Mapping the cosmic microwave background radiation.

programme.title: The Space Race, The Hubble, Chasing Comets & Space Debris
programme.desc: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration, S01E01, Cold War & The Start of the Space Race - Cold War rivalry and the acceleration of space exploration. Servicing Hubble - Preparations for Hubble's final servicing mission. Chasing a Comet - Launch and the difficult path to rendezvous.

programme.title: Beyond Earth Orbit, IXV Vehicles & Galileo Satellites Lost and Found
programme.desc: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration, S01E09, Beyond Earth Orbit - The Apollo program takes bold new steps. IXV Re-entry Vehicle - Europe is working to perfect a re-entry vehicle. Galileo Satellites Lost and Found - Navigation satellites go into incorrect orbit.

programme.title: Project Gemini Docking, Mars Curiousity & Satellite Swarms
programme.desc: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration, S01E06, Project Gemini: Docking and EVA - In the final phase of the Gemini program NASA struggles with docking and spacewalks. Curiosity Roving Mars - On the surface of Mars the Curiosity rover is changing the way we think about the red planet.

programme.title: Project Mercury Advancement, Camera Tracking & The International Space Station
programme.desc: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration, S01E03, Project Mercury Advances - America's first manned space program finally puts a man in orbit. Camera Tracking - The array of special cameras that follow a spacecraft at launch. The International Space Station - The building and operation.

programme.title: The Beginning of the End, Apollo Gets Complicated & The End of Apollo
programme.desc: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration, S01E11, The Beginning of the End - After the first Moon landing the Apollo science program was about to start in earnest but people were losing interest. Apollo Gets Complicated - New technology is added that extends the reach of the Apollo program.

programme.title: Project Gemini, Venus Express, EMU & Deep Space Communication
programme.desc: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration, S01E04, Project Gemini Commences - Did Gemini give the US a lead in the space race? Venus Express - The last days of ESA's Venus probe. EMU - NASA's Extravehicular Mobility Unit. Deep Space Communications - ESA's worldwide network of giant dishes.

programme.title: The Shuttle Program, The Challenger Disaster & Return to Space
programme.desc: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration, S01E12, The Shuttle Program - The first re-useable spacecraft. The Challenger Disaster - Pressing launch schedules lead to carelessness and the loss of the Challenger. Return to Space - A re-designed shuttle is back in space with a redefined role.

programme.title: Project Mercury, The Mars Express & The Soyuz Launch System
programme.desc: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration, S01E02, Project Mercury Begins - The start of NASA & America's first manned space program. Mars Express - The European Space Agency's Mars Satellite. The Soyuz Launch System - The gradual evolution of Russia's Soyuz launcher.

programme.title: To The Moon, SpaceX's Dragon and Falcon & GAIA
programme.desc: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration, S01E10, To the Moon - The Apollo program achieves its major objective. Dragon, Falcon and Spacex - New directions in re-usable spacecraft. Gaia- Mapping our galaxy in unprecedented detail.

programme.title: Project Gemini Advances, Cassini at Saturn & More About Mars
programme.desc: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration, S01E05, Project Gemini Advances - NASA refines the techniques needed for rendezvous. Cassini at Saturn - In the Cassini probe's final years of activity, its handlers are asking it to do more complex and risky assignments.

programme.title: Gravity
programme.desc: The New Frontier: Gravity, S03E09, LISA pathfinder, has led the way for a space based gravity wave detector, what are gravity waves and why are they so hard to detect?

programme.title: Cosmic Collisions
programme.desc: The New Frontier: Cosmic Collisions, S03E08, Cosmic and x rays, these mysterious and highly powerful particles from deep space are being investigated to finally discover where they come from.

programme.title: Ice Cold in Denver

programme.title: Cold Case Files Classics
programme.desc: Cold Case Files Classic, S05E17, In Rhode Island, policewomen go undercover as streetwalkers to nab the man suspected of murdering three prostitutes. And a dagger-shaped letter opener is the key piece of evidence that links a priest to the grisly 1980 murder of a nun in Ohio.

programme.title: Blood Money/Precious Doe

programme.title: Cold Case Files Classics
programme.desc: Cold Case Files Classic, S02E13, Police reopen a rape-murder case 25 years after the crime and find enough DNA evidence to bring him to justice. And a confession made to a "Baywatch" TV star helps police solve the three-year-old riddle of a wealthy Newport Beach woman's murder.

programme.title: Cold Case Files Classics
programme.desc: Cold Case Files Classic, S01E06, In Missouri, a part-time missionary is convicted, 38 years later, of killing her 5-year-old stepdaughter, and the skeleton of a Michigan boy, dead for 10 years, leads police to a serial killer.

programme.title: Cold Ashes
programme.desc: Cold Case Files, S02E20, When a deadly house fire claims the life of a family in rural Oklahoma, investigators suspect foul play and it sends a mother on a decades-long crusade to find out what happened to her missing teenage daughter and best friend.

programme.title: Kidnapped
programme.desc: Cold Case Files Classic, S04E01, A kidnapper grabs 8-year-old Chad Choice from his home in Texas, then torments his parents with two ransom demands. The case goes cold until the parents receive a chilling package in the mail that contains a letter--and a skull.

programme.title: Cold Case Files Classics
programme.desc: Cold Case Files Classic, S04E17, A look at the case of James Allen Selby, a serial rapist who eluded police for years while attacking 11 women in five states - Oklahoma, Nevada, California, Arizona, and Colorado.

programme.title: Cold Case Files Classics

programme.title: Cold Case Files Classics

programme.title: Foothold
programme.desc: Stargate SG-1, S03E14, During routine medical exams, Dr. Fraiser injects each team member with a sedative. Teal'c awakens and sees General Hammond conspiring with Fraiser and two aliens. What has happened at Stargate Command, and can SG-1 overpower its own allies?

programme.title: Pretense
programme.desc: Stargate SG-1, S03E15, When SG-1 is invited to planet Tollan to attend a Triad ceremony, they are shocked to discover it is actually a trial to determine the fate of their friend Skaara. Daniel and O'Neill must argue a case against a mysterious Goa'uld to save Skaara.

programme.title: Urgo
programme.desc: Stargate SG-1, S03E16, En route to a planet, the SG-1 are implanted with an alien spore that evolves into a being called Urgo. Though Urgo claims to be friendly, the suspicious team members work feverishly to rid themselves of the creature before it destroys their minds.

programme.title: A Hundred Days
programme.desc: Stargate SG-1, S03E17, SG-1 visits the friendly planet Edora and gathers to watch the annual meteor shower that lights up the sky like a fiery rain. But suddenly, wayward asteroids bombard the planet, destroying the Stargate. Can O'Neill and the team ever return home?

programme.title: Shades Of Grey
programme.desc: Stargate SG-1, S03E18, On a mission to Tollana, O'Neill steals a weapon there and takes it back to Earth. When Hammond discovers the deception, he suspends O'Neill. But O'Neill's misconduct is only the beginning of a deep mystery that could have catastrophic consequences.

programme.title: Phantoms
programme.desc: Stargate Atlantis, S03E09, Major Leonard's team fails to check in with Atlantis while on a mission. Following the energy readings in hope of finding Major Leonard and his men, McKay leads the team into a cave to discover that the cause the energy spike is a Wraith generator.

programme.title: The Return (Part 1)
programme.desc: Stargate Atlantis, S03E10, The now awakened Ancients meet with O'Neill and Woolsey, thanking them for taking care of the city but also asking them to vacate Atlantis. While Ronon and Teyla stay in the Pegasus galaxy, the rest struggle to resume their lives on Earth.

programme.title: The Return (Part 2)
programme.desc: Stargate Atlantis, S03E11, O'Neill and Woolsey, the lone survivors of the replicators' bloody coup, hide out in an abandoned section of the city. Knowing Landry has an order to nuke Atlantis if a foothold situation should ever arise, the two lay low awaiting their fate.

programme.title: Echoes
programme.desc: Stargate Atlantis, S03E12, Teyla begins to see apparitions of ancients in distress and believes they are the ghosts of the Ancients recently massacred by the Replicators. McKay believes he's found the whale that saved him a year ago while trapped in a submerged puddle jumper.

programme.title: Irresponsible
programme.desc: Stargate Atlantis, S03E13, The team hear of a great warrior with stories of defeating both the Genii and Wraith and seek him out in hopes of making a new ally. But when they learn this great warrior is none other than Lucius they believe he's up to his old tricks again.

programme.title: Tao Of Rodney
programme.desc: Stargate Atlantis, S03E14, Trying to preserve power by turning off all the non-essential systems the Ancients recently activated before being killed by the replicators, McKay mistakenly is hit by an energy beam from a mysterious device.

programme.title: The Game
programme.desc: Stargate Atlantis, S03E15, Lorne discovers a planet with dozens of satellites in orbit. However, inhabitants on this planet are no further advanced than the renaissance and have a flag with McKay's face. The team realize a game they had found earlier might be more than a game.

programme.title: The Ark
programme.desc: Stargate Atlantis, S03E16, Investigating an abandoned space station, McKay mistakenly brings one of its scientists out of stasis. The scientist explains to the team that the base was the last effort by his people to avoid the repeated culling they've endured by the Wraith.

programme.title: Common Descent
programme.desc: Stargate Universe, S02E17, Destiny discovers the survivors of an interplanetary expedition who claim their civilization, Novus, was founded two thousand years earlier by Destiny’s crew. Suddenly, they are attacked by the Drones who have discovered a way to track Destiny.

programme.title: Epilogue
programme.desc: Stargate Universe, S02E18, Returning the settlers to their home planet Novus, the Destiny crew discover the planet has been abandoned and is on the verge of seismic destruction. While pouring through an underground archive, the crew learns of the true origins of Novus.

programme.title: Blockade
programme.desc: Stargate Universe, S02E19, When Destiny’s attempt to recharge in a star is foiled by attacking drones, Eli suggests a risky plan to recharge in a super-hot blue giant…a star so hot it could destroy the ship…unless someone stays aboard and keeps the ship under manual control.

programme.title: Gauntlet
programme.desc: Stargate Universe, S02E20, After a battle, Destiny’s only option for survival is a jump to the next galaxy. Crew members return to Earth to say what may be their final farewells before embarking on their journey. But a risky stop may put the entire plan in jeopardy.
